title.rendered: Patrick Smith: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings, Wife

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Patrick Smith
    • Early and Professional Career
  • Patrick Smith’s Net Worth in 2023
    • Career Earnings
  • Personal Details
    • Wife
    • How old is he?
    • Height and Weight
    • Career Stats
    • FAQs About Patrick Smith

Patrick Smith is a renowned rodeo contestant, particularly known for his skills in team roping. He began his rodeo career in 1998 while he was in high school, despite having no prior knowledge about horses or team roping.

His career took off when he rode horses for three-time world champion Allen Bach and was introduced to PRCA Hall of Fame Roper Tee Woolman, which changed his life.

Here we have Patrick Smith’s net worth, career earnings, professional career, achievements, relationship status, and more.

About Patrick Smith

Patrick Smith, a native of Lipan, Texas, is a renowned figure in the world of professional rodeo. He is a two-time World Champion and a 13-time Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR) qualifier.

Smith’s journey in the rodeo arena began in 1998 when he started roping. His career took off in 2003 when he joined the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA) and qualified for the NFR the same year.

Smith’s family has been a significant part of his journey. His wife, Christi, and their children, Kylee, Kenzie, and Elijah, have been his pillars of support. His children’s desire to see him back at the NFR after a seven-year hiatus was a significant factor in his return to the arena.

Early and Professional Career

Patrick Smith is a renowned figure in the world of professional rodeo, particularly in team roping. He began his rodeo career in 1998 and joined the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA) in 2003. Smith has qualified for the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR) 13 times and is a two-time World Champion.

Throughout his career, Smith has partnered with notable ropers such as Matt Tyler, Clay Tryan, and Trevor Brazile. In 2003, he won the NFR average with partner Matt Tyler and was awarded the 2003 PRCA Team Roping Heeling Rookie of the Year. 

In 2005, Smith won the Team Roping World Championship at the NFR with partner Clay Tryan. His partnership with Trevor Brazile, which began in 2007, brought him another NFR average win in 2008 and the 2010 Team Roping World Championship.

As of 2023, Smith finished fifth in the world standings with $154,767. He won the West of the Pecos (Texas) Rodeo, the Greeley (Colo.) Stampede, and the American Royal (Kansas City)1. He has been roping with Tanner Tomlinson, with whom he went to the NFR.

Patrick Smith’s Net Worth in 2023

As of 2023, the estimated net worth of Patrick Smith is $5 million. This figure is based on his earnings as a professional rodeo cowboy, which has surpassed the $2 million mark.

Career Earnings

Patrick Smith, a renowned rodeo contestant, has had a successful career in the sport, amassing significant earnings over the years. As of 2023, Smith’s career earnings total $2,354,472.

His earnings in 2023 were boosted by his horse, Kadabra King, who was named the PRCA’s Nutrena Heel Horse of the Year for the second consecutive year. This horse helped Smith secure his 14th Wrangler National Finals Rodeo at No. 8 in the PRCA world standings with $118,706 in 2023 earnings.

Personal Details

Wife

Patrick Smith, the renowned rodeo contestant, is married to a woman named Christi. They have three children together: Kylee, Kenzie, and Elijah. The family resides in Lipan, Texas

How old is he?

Born in 1980, making him 43 years old as of 2023.

Height and Weight

He is 6 ft 1 inch tall and 180 lbs.

Career Stats

FAQs About Patrick Smith

What is Patrick Smith’s Net Worth?

Estimated $5 million as of 2023.

Who is his wife?

Christi.

Where does he live?

Lipan, Texas.

When did he start his professional rodeo career?

2003.
